title: Synthetic Recap
body:
ATLANTA (AP) – On a night when baskets were a precious commodity, one man staged a shooting exhibition for the ages. Dominique Wilkins, the "Human Highlight Film," turned back the clock and authored a defensive masterpiece, single-handedly dismantling the Dallas Mavericks in a 93-72 Hawks rout.

In a game defined by grit over grace, Wilkins was the lone supernova. While both teams struggled from the field, Wilkins operated on a different plane, pouring in a game-high **41 points**. He was a force of nature, attacking the rim with ferocious dunks and hitting from mid-range, accounting for over half of his team's total output and leaving the Mavericks' defense utterly bewildered.

The Hawks’ victory was anchored by a dominant rebounding performance from **Dikembe Mutombo**, who controlled the paint with **18 rebounds** and **3 blocks**, his imposing presence allowing Wilkins to flourish. Mookie Blayloch facilitated the attack with **9 assists**, ensuring the offense, however stagnant at times, ran through its primary weapon.

For Dallas, it was a night of profound frustration. Despite a strong all-around effort from **Jim Jackson (20 points, 7 rebounds, 6 assists)** and a double-double from **Jamal Mashburn (19 points, 10 rebounds)**, the Mavericks had no answer for Wilkins' historic onslaught. Their offense sputtered, shooting a collective 36% from the field, a statistic rendered insignificant by the singular brilliance unfolding on the other end.

The final score tells a story of a blowout, but the box score tells the legend of Dominique Wilkins. In an era defined by physical, low-scoring battles, a 41-point outburst wasn't just a great game; it was a monumental feat, a reminder to a sold-out Atlanta crowd and a defeated Dallas team that some stars burn brighter than the rest.
